      • setParameters

        boolean setParameters()

      • getPortNumber

        int getPortNumber()
        Port number within driver.

      • getSerial

        java.lang.String getSerial()
        The serial number of the underlying UsbDeviceConnection, or null.

      • open

        void open(android.hardware.usb.UsbDeviceConnection connection)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Opens and initializes the port. Upon success, caller must ensure that is eventually called.
        Parameters:
        connection - an open device connection, acquired with UsbManager.openDevice(android.hardware.usb.UsbDevice)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error opening or initializing the port.

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error closing the port.

      • read

        int read(byte[] dest,
         int timeoutMillis)
  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads as many bytes as possible into the destination buffer.
        Parameters:
        dest - the destination byte buffer
        timeoutMillis - the timeout for reading
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • write

        int write(byte[] src,
          int timeoutMillis)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes as many bytes as possible from the source buffer.
        Parameters:
        src - the source byte buffer
        timeoutMillis - the timeout for writing
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during writing

      • setParameters

        void setParameters(int baudRate,
                   int dataBits,
                   int stopBits,
                   int parity)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Sets various serial port parameters.
        Parameters:
        baudRate - baud rate as an integer, for example 115200.
        dataBits - one of DATABITS_5, DATABITS_6, DATABITS_7, or DATABITS_8.
        stopBits - one of STOPBITS_1, STOPBITS_1_5, or STOPBITS_2.
        parity - one of PARITY_NONE, PARITY_ODD, PARITY_EVEN, PARITY_MARK, or PARITY_SPACE.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error setting the port parameters

      • getCD

        boolean getCD()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the CD (Carrier Detect) bit from the underlying UART.
        Returns:
        the current state, or false if not supported.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • getCTS

        boolean getCTS()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the CTS (Clear To Send) bit from the underlying UART.
        Returns:
        the current state, or false if not supported.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • getDSR

        boolean getDSR()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the DSR (Data Set Ready) bit from the underlying UART.
        Returns:
        the current state, or false if not supported.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • getDTR

        boolean getDTR()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the DTR (Data Terminal Ready) bit from the underlying UART.
        Returns:
        the current state, or false if not supported.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • setDTR

        void setDTR(boolean value)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the DTR (Data Terminal Ready) bit on the underlying UART, if supported.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during writing

       throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the RI (Ring Indicator) bit from the underlying UART.
        Returns:
        the current state, or false if not supported.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • getRTS

        boolean getRTS()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the RTS (Request To Send) bit from the underlying UART.
        Returns:
        the current state, or false if not supported.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • setRTS

        void setRTS(boolean value)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the RTS (Request To Send) bit on the underlying UART, if supported.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during writing

      • purgeHwBuffers

        boolean purgeHwBuffers(boolean flushRX,
                       boolean flushTX)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Flush non-transmitted output data and / or non-read input data
        Parameters:
        flushRX - true to flush non-transmitted output data
        flushTX - true to flush non-read input data
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, or false if the operation is not supported by the driver or device
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during flush
